alert.note: Alert for Dundy; Hitchcock; Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 04 at 7:29PM CST until January 05 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST /NOON CST/ FRIDAY... * WHAT...Light accumulating snow. Snow accumulations ranging anywhere from a half inch to 3 inches, greatest south of Interstate 70. * WHERE...Entire Tri-State area. * WHEN...Until 11 AM MST /noon CST/ Friday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions associated with accumulating snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light accumulating snow will overspread the region from the south late this evening and overnight. The majority of precipitation is expected to occur between 9 PM MST this evening and 9 AM MST Friday morning. The relative greatest snow accumulations are anticipated to occur south of Interstate 70. Reduced visibilities associated with freezing fog can be expected prior to the onset of precipitation. Strong winds will not accompany this system. Expect southeast to east winds at 5 to 15 mph.
info.instruction: Drivers are urged to slow down and exercise additional caution, particularly at intersections and highway onramps and offramps where accidents are more likely to occur. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
